entry.title: The Rail Vehicle Accessibility (South West Trains Class 444 and Class 450 Vehicles) Exemption Order 2003
entry.summary: This version of the The Rail Vehicle Accessibility (South West Trains Class 444 and Class 450 Vehicles) Exemption Order 2003 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Local Authorities (Members' Allowances) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Local Authorities (Members' Allowances) (England) Regulations 2003 (“the first 2003 Regulations”) so as to allow more time for the authorities subject to those Regulations to comply with the requirements of those Regulations.

entry.title: The Misuse of Drugs (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: These regulations amend the Misuse of Drugs Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2002 (“the principal regulations”). Regulation 3(2) inserts 6A which provides that practitioners, pharmacists and persons employed or engaged in the lawful provision of drug treatment services may, where the articles detailed in regulation 6A(1)(a)-(e) are believed to be used for the purposes of administrating or preparing controlled drugs, lawfully supply or offer to supply these articles. Ampoules of water for injection, are a prescription only medicine and may only be supplied in accordance with the Medicines Act 1968.

entry.title: The Education (Assisted Places) (Incidental Expenses) (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Education (Assisted Places) (Incidental Expenses) Regulations 1997 (“the 1997 Regulations”) in respect of the school year beginning on or after 1st September 2003. The 1997 Regulations provide for the payment of grants as regards incidental expenses, and for the remission of incidental expenses, in respect of pupils eligible to continue to hold assisted places by virtue of section 2 of the Education (Schools) Act 1997, notwithstanding the abolition of the assisted places scheme by section 1 of that Act.

entry.title: The Care Homes (Amendment No. 2) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: This version of the The Care Homes (Amendment No. 2) Regulations 2003 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Merseyrail Electrics Network Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order relates to the Merseyrail Electrics railway network (“the network”).

entry.title: The Transport Act 2000 (Commencement No. 10) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 29th July 2003 section 228 of the Transport Act 2000 which provides for the amendment of certain provisions of sections 76 and 77 of the Railways Act 1993, which set out the general duties of the Rail Passengers’ Council and the Rail Passengers’ Committees respectively.

entry.title: The Motor Vehicles (Tests) (Amendment) (No.2) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Motor Vehicles (Tests) Regulations 1981 (“the 1981 Regulations”). Those Regulations make provision for certain motor vehicles to be examined by persons authorised by the Secretary of State and for test certificates to be issued for vehicles that are found to meet certain requirements. These certificates are commonly referred to as “MOT Certificates”.

entry.title: The Release of Short-Term Prisoners on Licence (Repeal of Age Restriction) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order amends section 34A(1) of the Criminal Justice Act 1991 so that the age restriction for early release under that section is removed. This means that short-term prisoners under the age of 18 will be eligible for release on licence under section 34A(3).

entry.title: The Pollution Prevention and Control (England and Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Pollution Prevention and Control (England and Wales) Regulations 2000 (the “PPC Regulations”).

entry.title: The Public Appointments and Public Bodies etc. (Scotland) Act 2003 (Commencement No. 2) Order 2003
entry.summary: The Public Appointments and Public Bodies etc. (Scotland) Act 2003 (“the Act”) received Royal Assent on 11th March 2003. Sections 18, 19, 20 and 21 came into force on Royal Assent.

entry.title: The International Carriage of Perishable Foodstuffs (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations change some fees payable under the International Carriage of Perishable Foodstuffs Regulations 1985.

entry.title: The Road Vehicles (Construction and Use) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: This version of the The Road Vehicles (Construction and Use) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2003 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Medical Devices (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Medical Devices Regulations 2002 (“the principal Regulations”), which contain the legislative measures necessary for the implementation of the European Community scheme for regulating the placing on the market and putting into service of medical devices. The amendments include amendments that are necessary for the implementation of Commission Directive 2003/12 of 3rd February 2003 on the reclassification of breast implants within the framework of Directive 93/42/EEC on medical devices (“Directive 2003/12”) and Commission Directive 2003/32 of 23rd April 2003 on medical devices utilising tissues of animal origin (“Directive 2003/32”).

entry.title: Industrial Training Levy (Construction Industry) Order (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: This Order gives effect to proposals submitted by the Construction Industry Training Board to the Department for Employment and Learning for the imposition of a further levy upon employers in the construction industry for the purpose of raising money towards the expenses of the Board.

entry.title: The International Fund for Agricultural Development (Fifth Replenishment) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order approves the making of a payment on behalf of the Government of the United Kingdom of a sum not exceeding £18,531,000 as a contribution to the resources of the International Fund for Agricultural Development in accordance with the arrangements made pursuant to the Resolution entitled “the Resolution 119/XXIV of the Governing Council of the Fund on the Fifth Replenishment of the Fund’s resources”, adopted on 22nd February 2001.

entry.title: The Charities (The Shrubbery) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order gives effect to a Scheme of the Charity Commissioners relating to the Charity known as The Shrubbery. The purpose of the Charity is to hold land for the enjoyment of the public as an open space under the Open Spaces Act 1906.

entry.title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Exemption) (Amendment) (No. 2) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order amends the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Exemption) Order 2001 (S.I. 2001/1201) (“the Exemption Order”). The Exemption Order provides for certain persons to be exempt from the general prohibition which is imposed by section 19 of the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 on carrying on a regulated activity in the United Kingdom unless authorised under that Act.

entry.title: The Health Act 1999 (Commencement No. 13) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 9th July 2003 section 60(3) of the Health Act 1999 (partially) and repeals in Schedule 5 to the Act (partially). The effect is that certain provisions in the Professions Supplementary to Medicine Act 1960 are repealed in consequence of the coming into force of the Health Professions Order 2001 (S.I. 2002/254). Other provisions in that Act were repealed by virtue of S.I. 2001/1985 and S.I. 2002/1167. Sections 2(5) and 14 remain in force.

entry.title: The Rail Vehicle Accessibility (Festiniog Railway Company Vehicle Number 122) Exemption Order 2003
entry.summary: This version of the The Rail Vehicle Accessibility (Festiniog Railway Company Vehicle Number 122) Exemption Order 2003 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.
